qas.question: How many branches make up the Portuguese armed forces?
What are the branches of the Portuguese armed forces?
What is the primary purpose of the Portuguese armed forces?

answers.text: primarily as a self-defense force whose mission is to protect the territorial integrity of the country and provide humanitarian assistance and security

qas.question: How many women were in the Portuguese armed forces in 2008?
How much money was spent on the Portuguese armed forced in 2009?

context: The armed forces have <a0_0>three<a0_0/> branches: <a1_0>Navy, Army and Air Force<a1_0/>. They serve <a2_0>primarily as a self-defense force whose mission is to protect the territorial integrity of the country and provide humanitarian assistance and security<a2_0/> at home and abroad. As of 2008, the three branches numbered 39,200 active personnel including <a3_0>7,500<a3_0/> women. Portuguese military expenditure in 2009 was <a4_0>$5.2 billion, representing 2.1 percent of GDP<a4_0/>. Military conscription was abolished in 2004. The minimum age for voluntary recruitment is 18 years.
